**Key Responsibilities:**

* Monitor and maintain fill operations that meet the BRC program.
* Maintain efficient operation of machinery while supporting the batching and closure process.

* Understanding of ingredients, batch temperatures, quality testing and product characteristics are critical skills for this position.
* When batching acidified product, required to cook the minimum to kill Pathogenic Organisms
* Maintain traceability of all ingredients added to batches.
* Follow safety regulations and procedures.
* QC will test finished batches for viscosity, taste, PH, and color.
* Make necessary adjustments to achieve the proper levels of the viscosity, taste, ph., and color.
* Load mixers with the correct weight for each recipe batch.
* Monitor product quality by maintaining required temperature check logs.
* Inventory check throughout the shift after each product batch is packaged and after all orders have been completed.
* Sanitize machines and Batching Area.
* Follow all plant safety regulations and Good Manufacturing Practices.
* Adhere to HACCP, Allergen Control Program, GMPs, product specifications, and other QA plans and required process control procedures to ensure processes, work in progress, raw materials and finished goods meet the specified quality and standards.
* Respect company policies and customer specifications.
* Conduct process checks appropriate to the product and equipment in use (e.g., Cook temperature, Cook Time, verify ingredient weights).
* Report issues regarding raw materials used for batching.

* Knowledge of assembly and disassembly of machinery and well as understanding of how to calibrate machines. Report all significant mechanical issues to shift supervisor.
* Assure that all documentation (production recipe logs, traceability records, WIP sheet) is complete and accurate and filed appropriately.
* Review specs and batching procedures of product to be run; assess equipment set-up and configuration needs; determine ingredient preparation needs and volume requirements.
* Check ingredients that are being brought in for accuracy and quality throughout the run.
* Ensure formula instructions and batching procedures are followed correctly throughout the run.
* Ensure cooking times and temperatures according to specifications are being always met and recorded accordingly.
* Ensure QA-released product is being pumped for filling, on a timely manner.

Orion also attends school via Los Angeles Unified School District (LAUSD), so during school vacations, etc., additional coverage will be needed as well.

*Due to Orion’s disabilities, he receives funding from the Westside Regional Center (https://westsiderc.org/) to meet his needs and for this service and staff. He is part of the Self-Determination Program (https://westsiderc.org/about-the-program/) which is why his family can select their own staff. Specifically, you will be hired by a Financial Management Service (FMS) as a W-2 employee paid hourly at a rate of $25.00 to $28.00 per hour based on performance and depending on experience; payment will be twice per month. You must be able to pass a background check and have a driving record acceptable to the FMS to qualify for this position, as well as reliable transportation to be able to drive Orion as needed. The FMS will be your Employer of Record and who you will report on your taxes.*

Please see below to learn more about Orion and determine if you are the person Orion and his family need!

**ORION IS:**

· Adorable (and he knows it!), with a great laugh. He has incredible positive energy.

· Routine and schedule oriented

· A music lover (including classic rock.) He likes music and singing songs, and he knows his parts. He likes reciprocal play and cause and effect.

· Very physically strong; he likes swimming, jumping on the trampoline, playing catch, and soccer.

· Curious; he loves to learn new things, especially with the right support. He loves activities that are sensory stimulating.

· Energetic, determined, & persistent

· Engaged and present in the current moment, and you should be too! He doesn’t “hold onto” anything negative and he is honest; he is who he is.

**YOU NEED TO:** 

· Be fully vaccinated against COVID-19

· Have your own, reliable, car, a clean driving record, and be able to drive Orion into the community as needed.

· Be fun! Orion is fun and it will be better for both of you if you enjoy being with him.

· Be present with Orion, physically *and* emotionally. Relationships are very important to him, and he needs to trust you. This is not the right job for you if you want to be able to be on your phone, because he needs constant supervision and if you are not providing it, he might get injured.

· Push Orion to be as independent as possible.

· Don’t think of Orion as limited; see Orion’s potential (and he has a lot!)

· Not be afraid of a G-Tube or challenging behaviors, including physical aggression and/or Self-Injurious Behaviors. Orion’s mom and current staff team will train you how to work best with him, redirect him while keeping both him & yourself safe, and to understand his communication.

· Be willing to provide hands-on support with G-Tubes feeding, toileting (changing diapers), personal care, dressing, etc.

· Be organized and prepared for each day

**ORION NEEDS:**

· Constant supervision, especially if he is upset; he has a Cortical Visual Impairment (CVI) that limits his ability to see and ambulate, an unsteady gait, and he may display challenging behaviors that could injure him or someone else if he is not redirected.

· Physical, hands-on, assistance with ambulation, personal care, toileting, and eating. His mom and current team will train you on how to work best with him in these areas.

· You to pay attention to his non-verbal communication, such as gestures and sounds, but to communicate with *him* verbally and consistently, because he can’t see you nodding, shaking your head, etc.

· To do things himself as much as possible; it doesn’t help him if you do it *for* him, but rather show *him* how to do it.

· To follow a routine.

* Two years’ experience working in a substance abuse treatment setting preferred.
* Basic understanding of child development, child abuse, substance abuse, and self-sufficiency issues.
* Experience working with substance abusers, chronically homeless, and/or reentry populations.

**Pruning:*** Must be able to prune young and mature trees using ISA and ANSI Z133.1 pruning standards, as well as Disney Show quality standards. Must be capable of safely using hand pruners, pole pruners, hand saws, pole saws and chainsaws to complete the job.

**Young Tree Care:*** Planting: Must be able to plant 15-gallon, 24-inch box trees using ISA and ANSI Z133.1 standards. Shoveling, bending, pushing/pulling and lifting (25-100 lbs.) are involved.

**Inventory Maintenance and Inspection:*** Involves tree tagging, tree inspection, recording of data in field and on the Access Database Inventory Program. Must have the ability to understand Arboriculture in regards to tree health and structure defects, as well as the ability to input data into the Access computer program.

**Mature Tree Care:*** Cabling and Bracing: Must be familiar with hardware and ISA/ANSI Z133.1 installation guidelines.
* Rigging: Must have the ability to safely perform rigging operations under the standards found in ISA/ANSI Z133.1. Must have the ability to gain proficiency and knowledge of different rigging systems.
* Removals: Must be proficient in safely removing trees (10-150 feet) using tools specified for pruning.

**Groundwork:*** Involves safely securing the work area, providing ground assistance to the climber(s) in the tree (knot knowledge), removing and loading, safely reducing the size of debris with a chainsaw, and safe chipper operation under ISA/ANSI Z133.1 standards.

**Emergencies:*** Must be able to handle and react to stressful emergency situations within the tree crew, as well as other possible Cast Member or Guest needs. Must be available on an on-call basis 24 hours a day 7 days a week.

Under the supervision of the Store Manager, the Operations Manager will maintain an engaged, productive store team through strong leadership, demonstrating initiative and leading by example.


The Operations Manager is responsible for supporting the Store Manager in the total leadership and strategic operation of a CVS/pharmacy store including:

* Overall store management, supervision, and policy implementation
* Sales and inventory management
* Employee staffing, training, and development
* Financial management
* Customer service leadership


Unlike the Store Manager in Training position, the Operations Manager position is not part of the CVS/pharmacy Retail Management Development Program. Operations Managers are not eligible for direct promotion to Store Manager. Candidates with a short-term goal of becoming a CVS Store Manager should instead apply for Store Manager in Training openings.


Essential Functions:


1. Management


Lead others and work effectively with store crews


Supervise, assign and direct activities of the store’s crew


Effectively communicate information to store crew and supervisors in an open and timely manner


Support Store Manager with actions plans for operational and service improvement


2. Customer Service


Assist customers with their questions, problems and complaints


Promote CVS customer service culture (greet, offer help, and thank)

* Deductive reasoning ability, advanced analytical skills and computer skills.
* Advanced communication skills, leadership, supervision, and influencing skill
* Ability to work a full-time flexible schedule, including some early morning, overnight and weekend shifts, to work overtime as needed, and to respond to urgent issues at the store when they arise
